bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 150 (Tuesday, August 24, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GOSAR:H.R. 5087.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8,[Page H4488]

item.name: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands Subcommittee
National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Laughlin/Bullhead International Airport Land Conveyance Act

This bill directs the Department of the Interior, at the request of Mohave County in Arizona, to convey approximately 10 acres of identified federal land (including any improvements) administered by the Bureau of Land Management to the county.

The federal land conveyed shall be used only for public purposes by the Mohave County Airport Authority.

Interior must convey the land without consideration and by quitclaim deed within one year of receiving the request from the county.

bill.title: Laughlin/Bullhead International Airport Land Conveyance Act

item.title: Laughlin/Bullhead International Airport Land Conveyance Act
Laughlin/Bullhead International Airport Land Conveyance Act
To direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey certain Federal land located in Mohave County, Arizona, to Mohave County, Arizona, for public purposes of use by the Mohave County Airport Authority.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
